Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and describe two different types of habitats, such as land and water habitats.
The student can observe and include different types of living things in each habitat, like trees and squirrels in a land habitat or fish and clams in a water habitat.
The student can compare the variety of plants and animals found in each habitat to show differences in biodiversity.
The student can illustrate patterns in the diversity of plant and animal life across the two habitats by observing and drawing their findings.
The student can organize their drawing to clearly show which plants and animals belong to each habitat and how they were observed.
